item.title: Ahimsa add a quote by Neal Stephenson
item.description: "Until a man is twenty-five, he still thinks, every so often, that under the right circumstances he could be the baddest motherfucker in the world. If I moved to a martial-arts monastery in China and studied real hard for ten years. If my family was wiped out by Colombian drug dealers and I swore myself to revenge. If I got a fatal disease, had one year to live, and devoted it to wiping out street crime. If I just dropped out and devoted my life to being bad." -- Neal Stephenson

item.title: Ahimsa add a quote by Ernest Cline
item.description: "You'd be amazed how much research you can get done when you have no life whatsoever." -- Ernest Cline

item.title: Ahimsa add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "It doesn't matter. I have books, new books, and I can bear anything as long as there are books." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Ahimsa add a quote by Steve Inskeep
item.description: "Heritage is a matter of the stories we choose to tell about our past, as well as the stories we overlook." -- Steve Inskeep

item.title: Ahimsa add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Ahimsa add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "If you go home with somebody, and they don't have books, don't fuck 'em!" -- John Waters

item.title: Ahimsa add a quote by Neal Stephenson
item.description: "Besides, interesting things happen along borders—transitions—not in the middle where everything is the same." -- Neal Stephenson

item.title: Ahimsa add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Ahimsa add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "Bibliotropic," Hugh said. "Like sunflowers are heliotropic, they naturally turn towards the sun. We naturally turn towards the bookshop." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Ahimsa add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "The thing about Tolkien, about <i>The Lord of the Rings</i>, is that it's perfect. It's this whole world, this whole process of immersion, this journey. It's not, I'm pretty sure, actually true, but that makes it more amazing, that someone could make it all up. Reading it changes everything." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Ahimsa add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "Tolkien understood about the things that happen after the end. Because this is after the end, this is all the Scouring of the Shire, this is figuring out how to live in the time that wasn’t supposed to happen after the glorious last stand. I saved the world, or I think I did, and look, the world is still here, with sunsets and interlibrary loans. And it doesn’t care about me any more than the Shire cared about Frodo." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Ahimsa add a quote by Scarlett Thomas
item.description: "Real life is physical. Give me books instead. Give me the invisibility of the contents of books, the thoughts, the ideas, the images. Let me become part of a book. . . . an intertextual being: a book cyborg, or, considering that books aren't cybernetic, perhaps a bibliorg." -- Scarlett Thomas

item.title: Ahimsa add a quote by Ted Simon
item.description: "To be worth making at all, a journey has to be made in the mind as much as in the world of objects and dimensions." -- Ted Simon

item.title: Ahimsa add a quote by Gregory David Roberts
item.description: "Sometimes we love with nothing more than hope. Sometimes we cry with everything except tears." -- Gregory David Roberts

item.title: Ahimsa add a quote by China Miéville
item.description: "Art is something you choose to make... it's a bringing together of... of everything around you into something that makes you more human, more khepri, whatever. More of a person." -- China Miéville

item.title: Ahimsa add a quote by China Miéville
item.description:
"Its substance was known to me. The crawling infinity of colours, the chaos of textures that went into each strand of that eternally complex tapestry…each one resonated under the step of the dancing mad god, vibrating and sending little echoes of bravery, or hunger, or architecture, or argument, or cabbage or murder or concrete across the aether. The weft of starlings’ motivations connected to the thick, sticky strand of a young thief’s laugh. The fibres stretched taut and glued themselves solidly to a third line, its silk made from the angles of seven flying buttresses to a cathedral roof. The plait disappeared into the enormity of possible spaces.
Every intention, interaction, motivation, every colour, every body, every action and reaction, every piece of physical reality and the thoughts that it engendered, every connection made, every nuanced moment of history and potentiality, every toothache and flagstone, every emotion and birth and banknote, every possible thing ever is woven into that limitless, sprawling web.
It is without beginning or end. It is complex to a degree that humbles the mind. It is a work of such beauty that my soul wept...
..I have danced with the spider. I have cut a caper with the dancing mad god." -- China Miéville

item.title: Ahimsa add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "Ogion went on a halfmile or so, and said at last, 'To hear, one must be silent'." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Ahimsa add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "What good is power when you're too wise to use it?" -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Ahimsa add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "The wise needn't ask, the fool asks in vain." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Ahimsa add a quote by Kim Stanley Robinson
item.description: "An excess of reason is itself a form of madness" -- Kim Stanley Robinson

item.title: Ahimsa add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "Scars have the strange power to remind us that our past is real." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Ahimsa add a quote by Mikhail Bulgakov
item.description: "manuscripts don't burn" - "(рукописи не горят)" -- Mikhail Bulgakov

item.title: Ahimsa add a quote by Mikhail Bulgakov
item.description: "Cowardice is the most terrible of vices." -- Mikhail Bulgakov

item.title: Ahimsa add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Ahimsa add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "It is not despair, for despair is only for those who see the end beyond all doubt. We do not." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Ahimsa add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "For even the very wise cannot see all ends." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Ahimsa add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Many that live deserve death. And some that die deserve life. Can you give it to them? Then do not be too eager to deal out death in judgement." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Ahimsa add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "The treacherous are ever distrustful." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Ahimsa add a quote by China Mieville
item.description: "The problem with most genre fantasy is that it's not nearly fantastic enough. It's escapist, but it can't escape." -- China Mieville

item.title: Ahimsa add a quote by Alan Wilson Watts
item.description: "Man suffers only because he takes seriously what the gods made for fun." -- Alan Wilson Watts
